Posts.Content: Feb 12, 2008 09:53PM bgraham2ny wrote: Grannie... Fear not.  I had my first chemo treatments 2/11/08 and I was very stressed out over it.  But I have been so fortunate thru all of this.  I had a port put in a couple of weeks ago, only for the fact that they cannot use my left arm for bp, iv, draw blood, etc because of the lymph nodes (20) they removed.  And the right arm wouldn't be able to handle all the treatments.  But anyway, I had not one symptom after the first treatment.  My Dr. gave me a ton of nausea medication and it must have helped.  Then once between treatments, she gives me a shot to boost the white blood count.  My hair isn't gone yet but maybe after the next treatment in 2 weeks.  I'll let you know.  Good luck with yours and I pray it goes well for you.  We've been through enough already, huh?
Posts.Title: Chemo starting Feb 2008? nowwhat cancerviking

Posts.Content: Feb 13, 2008 08:28AM bgraham2ny wrote: Donnalee Good luck starting your chemo.  Just want to give you a little bit of hope.  I started mine 2/11 and did so well.  I did have a port put in because I can't have any needles, blood pressure, etc from the left arm.  My dr must have done well with the nausea meds because I didn't even get a little queazy and so far not much more than the normal tiredness.  Hair is still in tact for a bit, but I'm slightly prepared for that.  I know everyone's treatments can go differently, but just wanted to let you know there's always a chance it won't be so bad and that's one more out of the way from this whole thing being over with.  For me, June is going to be a great month.  Best of luck to you. Becca
